Items.Title: Roll Call
Invocation
Items.AgendaNote:
Delivered by: Pastor Joseph Tolton, Rehoboth Temple Christ Conscious Church, 435 West 141st Street, New York, NY 10031.

Motion to spread the invocation in full upon the record by Council Member Jackson.
Items.MinutesNote:
The Invocation was delivered by:Pastor Joseph Tolton, Rehoboth Temple Christ Conscious Church, 435 West 141st Street, New Tork, N.Y. 10031.

Council Member Jackson moved to spread the Invocation in full upon the Record.

Items.Title: Adoption of Minutes
Items.AgendaNote: Motion that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 28, 2008 be adopted as printed by Council Member Nelson.
Items.MinutesNote: Council Member Nelson moved that the Minutes of the Stated Meeting of May 28, 2008 be adopted as printed.

Items.Title: Messages & Papers from the Mayor
Communications from City, County & Borough Offices
Petitions and Communications
Land Use Call-Ups

By the Chair of the Land Use Committee Council Member Katz
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(c) of the Council and Section 197-d (b)(3) of the New York City Charter, the Council hereby resolves that the action of the City Planning Commission on Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. 080178 ZSM  and shall be subject to Council review.  These items are related Uniform Land Use Procedure Application no. N 080177 ZRM.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Land Use Call-Up be Approved, by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: ULURP, Park Avenue Hotel Acquisition, LLC, Manhattan (N080177ZRM)

Items.Title: Report of the Committee on Housing and Buildings
A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring certain buildings or structures to undergo a structural inspection.
Items.ActionText: A motion was made that this Introduction be Approved by Council approved by consent Roll Call.
Items.MatterName: Requiring any building or structure that has been vacant for three years or longer to be inspected prior to the issuance of any permit to alter, repair, remove or enlarge that building or structure.

Items.Title:
Introduction & Reading of Bills
See Attached
Discussion of Resolutions
Resolutons
General Discussion
Extension of Remarks
INTRODUCTION AND READING OF BILLS

Resolution calling on the President to direct the Department of Justice to review how the Americans with Disabilities Act protections against discrimination contained in Title I are applied and enforced.
Items.AgendaNote: Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse & Disability Services
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Mental Retardation, Alcoholism, Drug Abuse and Disability Services
Items.MatterName: Review how the Americans with Disabilities Act protections against discrimination contained in Title I are applied and enforced.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the City of New York, in relation to campaign finance law.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Governmental Operations
Items.MatterName: Campaign finance law.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the Administration for Childrens Services to provide certain information on its website, submit material to the City Council, and to adhere to reporting requirements.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Administration for Childrens Services to provide certain information on its website, submit material to the City Council, and to adhere to reporting requirements.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York City Department of Education to develop a plan for the construction and/or renovation of school gymnasiums as part of its Five-Year Capital Plan in order to comply with New York State physical education requirements and to provide for healthy children and youth.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: Dept of Education to develop a plan for the construction and/or renovation of school gymnasiums as part of its Five-Year Capital Plan.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass A4459-A/ S5351-A requiring the Metropolitan Transit Authority, including the Long Island Rail Road, Metro-North commuter rail road and the New York City Transit Authority, to make automated external defibrillators available on every train.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Long Island Rail Road, Metro-North commuter rail road and the New York City Transit Authority, to make automated external defibrillators available on every train.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State legislature to pass and Governor to sign A. 1900 and S. 3530, which recognize the linkage between child abuse and animal abuse, and require that both Child Protective Service workers and Humane Law Enforcement officers become mandated reporters of that possibility in instances where there are both children and animals in a home and there is a possibility both are being subjected to cruelty or maltreatment.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: NYS legislature to pass and Governor to sign A.1900 and S.3530, which recognize the linkage between child abuse and animal abuse.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York City Department of Education to survey schools to assess compliance with curriculum mandates in the State Education Law and in the Regulations of the Commissioner of the State Education Department, and to assist schools that are not in compliance with such mandates to fully comply with the law.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Education
Items.MatterName: DOE  to survey schools to assess compliance with curriculum mandates in the State Education Law and in the Regulations of the Commissioner of the State Education Dept.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to providing paid family leave to private employees.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Civil Service and Labor
Items.MatterName: Providing paid family leave to private employees.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the New York State Legislature to pass and the Governor to sign A.3477, currently pending in the New York State Assembly, which would expand eligibility for child care assistance by increasing the income eligibility minimum from two hundred percent of the state income standard to three hundred percent of the state income standard.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on General Welfare
Items.MatterName: Expand eligibility for child care assistance by increasing the income eligibility minimum from 200% of the state income standard to 300% of the state income standard. (A.3477)

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the New York State Assembly to pass A.3948-A, which would direct the Commissioner of Criminal Justice Services to establish a pilot program for the use of video equipment in police vehicles in five New York City precincts.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Public Safety
Items.MatterName: Establish a pilot program for the use of video equipment in police vehicles in five New York City precincts.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the Department of Transportation to institute a Residential Parking Program for Greater Downtown Brooklyn.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: DOT to institute a Residential Parking Program for Greater Downtown Brooklyn.

Items.Title: Resolution pursuant to the New York State Environmental Quality Review Act setting forth findings of the Council concerning the environmental review conducted for Int. No. 779.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Economic Development
Items.MatterName: NYS Environmental Quality Review Act setting forth findings of the Council concerning the environmental review conducted for Int. No. 779.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to light-emitting diode bulbs in street lamps.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Light-emitting diode bulbs in street lamps.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the United States Congress to provide immediate funding for mass transit expansion and improvements and to subsidize fuel costs for public transit systems.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
Items.MatterName: Provide immediate funding for mass transit expansion and improvements and to subsidize fuel costs for public transit systems.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the labeling of foods that present a choking hazard.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Labeling of foods that present a choking hazard.

Items.Title: Resolution calling on the United States Congress to pass The Data Accountability and Trust Act, which protects consumers by requiring reasonable security policies and procedures to safeguard computerized data containing personal information and provides for a nationwide notice in the event of a security breach.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Consumer Affairs
Items.MatterName: The Data Accountability and Trust Act

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to the establishment of the Belmont business improvement district.
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Finance
Items.MatterName: Belmont business improvement district.

Items.Title: Resolution calling upon the State of New York to pass legislation that would amend the Public Health Law by requiring coroners and medical examiners to identify each individual who died of injuries related to exposure to the World Trade Center during or after the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks as a victim of the September 11, 2001 terrorist attacks, and to note such information in the victims death certificate.
Items.ActionText: This Resolution was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
Items.MatterName: Public Health Law by requiring coroners and medical examiners to identify each individual who died of injuries related to exposure to the World Trade Center during or after the September 11, 2001.

Items.Title:
By The Speaker (Council Member Quinn):
Pursuant to Rule 11.20(b) of the Council and Section 20-225(g) of the New York City Administrative Code, the Council resolves that the action of the Department of Consumer Affairs approving an unenclosed sidewalk caf located at 216 8th Avenue, Community Board 4, Application 20085552 TCM shall be subject to review by the Council.
